data.title: Stats Screen
data.body: Please bring back the stats screen for RA with kills, deaths, destroyed buildings etc.

data.title: merge Dune 2000 "Rounded Edges" mod
data.body:
Changes include:
- bibs have been removed
- building offset and selection boxes adapted
- units and turrets leave husks
- siege tank barrel won't rotate anymore
- AI capable of building all units using all queues
- bullet traces
- windtrap animations
- unit balance (mix of Dune II, Dune 2000 and Red Alert)
- repair pad animation
- no more obsessive "silos needed"
- defense building queue â†’ heavy armor queue
- medics (using thumper graphics)
- no buildable aircrafts anymore
- harvesting has been slowed down

Thanks to -Jes- and @bellator.

data.title: move from custom Tao.FreeType to SharpFont
data.body: Thanks to @Robmaister for the new C# bindings.

data.title: Fixed hotkeys for aircraft, ships, infantry, and vehicles
data.body: Fixed hotkeys for aircraft, ships, infantry, and vehicles

data.title: Server Shutdown Doesn't Remove Game from Master List
data.body:
When the server is shutdown the master server should pinged with a state that
causes the server to be removed from the list. 

This means that if a server shuts down correctly it will be removed from the server list right away. Some changes have been made to the MasterServer to go with this.

data.title: Improve gameplay - 'Build off Ally Con.yard'
data.body:
crosspost: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=283580#283580

After playing openRA on and off for a while, there is one thing I'd like to see changed more than anything else when playing multiplayer games: 
- Building structures next to your Ally can be done only with his/her Con.yard. 

To be honest, I'm not too good with team-basewalking. When I face a front of buildings coming my way faster than my army can move on the ground, I usually raise my hands up in disbelief rather than calling up on my allies to help out build my opponents. 

The fact is, too often new players are coming in only to be discouraged by established players who take control of the game with aggressive team-basewalking all over the map. New players remember the old Red Alert as a game of tanks, infantry,ships and aircrafts out on the battlefield, with a well established base supporting their army. When this nostalgic dream is countered by a rock solid wall of structures taking control of all resources on the map within 2 minutes, knocking on your front door in 4, they often leave never to return and we're left with a core of experienced players with a refined base stratergy that will shut out new players forever. 

If building off ally construction yard was the default option it would change how we play the game significantly by forcing team players to support eachother with an army rather than with defensive structures. You could still basewalk by yourself and move your con.yard to establish a new base for your team. **Edit from Sleipnir's forum: I also think this would be a better solution than a con.yard distance-build-limit as proposed earlier by other players who wanted to try restrict basewalking: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2156

The idea might go against the established players comfy levels but if you want the game to grow stronger beyond what we have today, then I feel this change HAS to be done. The gameplay will improve anyway.

data.title: Feature request: Replay viewer needs a fog-of-war option!
data.body:
crosspost: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=16040

I can watch replays for hours but when you watch a game with a lot of players it gets hard to keep track of everything. What is needed is a fog-of-war option to easier see all the troops, buildings, spy-planes etc. and their viewing range. 

I'm getting hold of a new PC in a week and I'm thinking of casting some replays and streaming some games in the future. If you programming geniuses could take care of this one small feature you'd make watching replays 10x more interesting! 

Be prosperous, do this asap! :c)

data.title: Feature request: team colors
data.body:
Starcraft II has a nice feature: you can switch from player color to team colors. Then the enemy players are red, the allies are yellow and the own units are green. 

This is very useful for team based matches.

data.title: [website] link OpenRA - Ressources
data.body: http://content.open-ra.org/ is really well done. I think it should be integrated into or at least be linked at http://open-ra.org

data.title: Catch all desync exceptions
data.body: I don't understand why we have to crash when a desync occurs. Why not spit out a Debug: message showing the diff, halt the game, then every client updates all variables from the server and unpause the game once everything is back in sync.

data.title: Use git submodules for dependency tracking.
data.body:
Instead having binaries inside the git repositories we might want to use git submodules and automatize their build. This makes it easier to create proper packages for distributions. Currently it creates a DLL hell because openra bundles many libraries and this confuses automatic dependency generation on http://build.opensuse.org/ The github web-interface also automagically links to the dependencies so it becomes clearer for developers and end-users what code is used.

_ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib:_ `nant build-net-2.0` works
_Mono.Nat:_ plain and simple `xbuild` works best
_Tao:_ This is somehow complex. I don't know how this works. All the .sh scripts will fail and it needs to create the files for autotools and nant with some other tool. Help is appreciated.
